DataElement.preferredName: Primary Site Surgical Procedure Excision Post Induction Chemotherapy Cycle Occurrence Treatment Course Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text that describes the cycle number that resection of primary site was performed.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Primary Site Surgical Procedure Excision Post Induction Chemotherapy Cycle Occurrence
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value._A position in relation to its surroundings._A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery._The act of cutting out; the surgical removal of part or all of a structure or organ._Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order._The act of bringing about something._The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases._An event or sequence of events that constitute a round or succession of observable phenomena, recurring usually at regular or approximately regular time intervals and in the same sequence._An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value.:A position in relation to its surroundings.:A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.:The act of cutting out; the surgical removal of part or all of a structure or organ.

Concepts.definition: Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value.
A position in relation to its surroundings.

A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.
The surgical removal of a lesion, often as part of a biopsy and with healthy margins.

Property.preferredDefinition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.:The act of bringing about something.:The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.:An event or sequence of events that constitute a round or succession of observable phenomena, recurring usually at regular or approximately regular time intervals and in the same sequence.:An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

Concepts.definition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.
The act of bringing about something.
The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.
An event or sequence of events that constitute a round or succession of observable phenomena, recurring usually at regular or approximately regular time intervals and in the same sequence.
An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: a protocol specific identifier used to indicate the treatment course or cycle.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Changed max length from 10 to 6 and datatype to Number per CDUS clean-up.

DataElement.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form
